branchCategory.name: Rodless Cylinder Mechanically Jointed
branchCategory.description: <p>A rodless cylinder with mechanical joining differs from a basic air cylinder in that no piston rod extends outside the cylinder body. Instead, the internal piston is connected to an external carriage.  SMC's rodless cylinders are ideal for long stroke applications because they are unaffected by rod overhang, bending, piston binding, and uneven seal wear, and for use in confined areas where space is a premium.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed - Basic Type
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder, basic type can be combined with a variety of guides to accommodate&nbsp;conditions. &nbsp;This is a simple design without guides to facilitate space savings.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed - Slide Bearing
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder with a slide bearing type comes with on integrated guide.  This can be used in a medium loading situation and allow direct mounting of a work piece.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed - Cam Follower Guide
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder with a cam follower type makes smooth operation possible even with an off-set load.  This can be used in a offset loading situation, high accuracy and long strokes.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed - Linear Guide
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder with a linear guide type are ideal for pick and place applications.  This uses a linear guide to achieve high repeatability.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed- High Precision Guide
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder with a high precision guide type are ideal for transfer and pick and place of high load work pieces.  This uses two linear guides to allow higher loading.</p>

branchItem.name: Rodless Cylinder - Mechanically Jointed - w/ Protective Cover
branchItem.description: <p>The rodless cylinder with a protective cover type are good when the cylinder is exposed to powder, dust and water drops. &nbsp;The protective cover only minimally adds to the overall length and width.</p>
